definitions.definition: To legally dissolve a marriage between two people.
examples: A ship captain can marry couples, but cannot divorce them.

definitions.definition: To end one's own marriage to (a person) in this way.
examples: Lucy divorced Steve when she discovered that he had been unfaithful.
Edna and Simon divorced last year; he got the house, and she retained the business.

definitions.definition: To separate something that was connected.
examples: The radical group voted to divorce itself from the main faction and start an independent movement.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To legally dissolve a marriage between two people.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To end one's own marriage to (a person) in this way.
( intransitive ) To obtain a legal divorce.
( transitive ) To separate something that was connected.
